summary: This bill, H.R. 3957, amends the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to authorize the President to provide fire management assistance to Indian Tribal Governments.  It allows tribal governments to directly request assistance and requires FEMA to directly receive and provide grants related to such requests.  The bill also mandates the President to update regulations within a year to implement these changes, considering tribal welfare and requiring government-to-government consultation. The bill's intent is to improve assistance to tribal governments during fire emergencies.
